Class BezierCurveUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • kr.ac.kaist.team888.bezier.BezierCurveUtils

extends java.lang.Object
    Utils for Bezier curve manipulations.

    • Method Detail

      • stroke

        public static java.util.ArrayList<BezierCurve> stroke(java.util.ArrayList<BezierCurve> curves,
                                                      double delta,
                                                      double roundness,
                                                      double contrast)
        Strokes the sequence of Bezier curves by given distance with the Tiller-Hanson algorithm.

        Stroking is basically offsetting in both sides of the given curves. This method connects upper and lower offset curves to make a whole contour.

        Parameters:
        curves - sequence of Bezier curves to stroke
        delta - distance to stroke
        Returns:
        a stroked contour in the form of a sequence of Bezier curves

      • stroke

        public static java.util.ArrayList<BezierCurve> stroke(java.util.ArrayList<BezierCurve> curves,
                                                      BezierCurveOffsetMethodType offsetMethod,
                                                      double delta,
                                                      double roundness,
                                                      double contrast)
        Strokes the sequence of Bezier curves by given distance with the given offset algorithm.

        Stroking is basically offsetting in both sides of the given curves. This method connects upper and lower offset curves to make a whole contour.

        Parameters:
        curves - sequence of Bezier curves to stroke
        offsetMethod - offset method to apply
        delta - distance to stroke
        Returns:
        a stroked contour in the form of a sequence of Bezier curves

      • getLength

        public static double getLength(BezierCurve curve,
                               double min,
                               double max)
        Returns the curve length of a Bezier curve from min to max.

        This integration is calculated by using Romberg's method. Note that negative value would be returned if min is bigger than max.

        Parameters:
        curve - a Bezier curve
        min - minimum value of length range
        max - maximum value of length range
        Returns:
        the curve length of a Bezier curve from min to max

      • getLength

        public static double getLength(BezierCurve[] curves,
                               double min,
                               double max)
        Returns the curve length of a sequence of Bezier curves from min to max.

        i to (i+1) is the range for i-th curve in the sequence beginning with i=0.

        This integration is calculated by using Romberg's method. Note that negative value would be returned if min is bigger than max.

        If the sequence is empty, it returns 0.

        Parameters:
        curves - a sequence of Bezier curves
        min - minimum value of length range
        max - maximum value of length range
        Returns:
        the curve length of Bezier curves from min to max

      • comparePoints

        public static boolean comparePoints(BezierCurve source,
                                    BezierCurve target)
        Returns true when both lengths of source(A) & target(B) are same. (Each Vector2D of A compared with Vector2D of B at same index) Otherwise return false.
        Parameters:
        source - The BezierCurve which be a criterion.
        target - A BezierCurve which will be compared with source.
        Returns:
        boolean.

      • interpolate

        public static BezierCurve interpolate(BezierCurve source,
                                      BezierCurve target,
                                      double proportion)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return new BezierCurve between source(A) and target(B). If proportion is 0, return same BezierCurve with A. If proportion is 1, return same BezierCurve with B. Otherwise, return a BezierCurve between A & B.
        Parameters:
        source - The BezierCurve which be a criterion.
        target - A BezierCurve has maximum interpolate points.
        proportion - double value, 0 <= range <= 1.
        Returns:
        new BezierCurve
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
